tweet:
An important read by my friend @RepUnderwood. Countless Black mothers should be celebrating Mother’s Day with their families today but they’re dead, in part, because of racial bias in our health care system.

Thinking about them today and every day. https://t.co/yZOE80nMy7
My Saving Our Street Act is about getting help to those businesses that need it most. It provides grants to help small, neighborhood business down your street—not Wall Street. https://t.co/lQkJXIUZBm
Attorney General Bill Barr has corrupted our justice system by acting more like Trump's personal attorney than the nation’s chief law enforcement officer. I'll say it again: Barr must resign.

Proud to see California taking steps so our people can safely cast their ballot. Ensuring our elections are safe and accessible during this pandemic must be a national priority.

My VoteSafe Act is critical to doing that nationwide. https://t.co/GhESu0O2xK

People need help throughout this crisis. It's just that simple. My new bill will provide $2,000 a month for the duration of the pandemic—and for 3 months after—to ensure folks can get back on their feet.

THREAD—let's talk about what's happening at Terminal Island prison.

On March 5, I was the first senator to demand the Bureau of Prisons prepare for COVID-19. Then, on April 2, I called on Terminal Island prison to lay out their plan to prepare for COVID-19.

Neither happened.

California has been torn apart by wildfires in recent years, and climate change is making things worse. It's unacceptable that FEMA is dragging its feet planning for natural disasters during this pandemic.

FEMA needs to get its act together. Lives are at stake. https://t.co/jRvtmnDC5e

My new bill with @SenSanders and @SenMarkey will provide monthly $2,000 payments to help people get through this crisis.

Bills come in every single month during the pandemic and so should help from our government. https://t.co/9aVuULCUue

Today, I'm introducing the Monthly Economic Crisis Support Act to provide $2,000 every month throughout this crisis.

I've been saying it for months: a one-time payment is not enough when millions of people are unemployed and need to eat. We need bold action, immediately.

Trump is questioning the accuracy of the COVID-19 death toll because it ultimately highlights his failure of leadership during this pandemic. The American people deserve better than this.

I'm pushing FEMA and HHS to ensure an accurate death toll. https://t.co/IlD0YSuCmf

Health care should be a right, not a privilege. But let’s be clear: if Trump and Republicans had their way, the Affordable Care Act would be overturned and millions more would be without health care. This is immoral. https://t.co/n0ZzPR8uKs

Frontline workers are risking their lives every day to keep Americans safe during this pandemic—they deserve to be protected and paid fairly. Congress must #ProtectEssentialWorkers and include the Essential Workers Bill of Rights in our next relief package.

I’m tired of seeing large corporations bailed out with taxpayer dollars while our smallest businesses just down the street are on the brink of collapse.

Yesterday, I introduced the Saving Our Street Act to create a $125 billion fund to help micro businesses—not Wall Street.

This is so important. Californians can now visit https://t.co/GVGzE6zMzd to find their nearest testing site and make an appointment. Once again, our state is showing leadership during this public health crisis. https://t.co/drge79zAwl

Carlos's death was likely preventable. My heart goes out to his family.

For months, I have called on DHS and BOP to act quickly to prevent the spread of COVID-19 at facilities like Otay Mesa Detention Center. They must take every step available to prevent more illness and loss. https://t.co/iGtfFWQaAV

Let's speak truth about this. When a Black woman has a son, she knows that he may never be safe because of the color of his skin. No parent should have to fear this.

Ahmaud Arbery's family deserves swift justice. #JusticeForAhmaud
.@RepPressley is a dear friend of mine and I could not be more excited to work with her on our new bill, the Saving Our Street Act. https://t.co/OdpNaKKiS4

I said at the Homeland Security Committee in February that we must hear from top Trump administration officials in charge of addressing this pandemic.

It's been 2 months since our last oversight hearing while the death toll is mounting. Unacceptable. https://t.co/x8N3IT8nYO

The American people are tired of taxpayer funds going to big corporations while neighborhood businesses continue to struggle. My new bill is about saving the micro businesses just down the street—not Wall Street. https://t.co/e3gsZ5aHZ0

Think about the micro businesses down the street—they’re the heart and soul of our communities and they need help. @RepPressley and I introduced the Saving our Street Act today to get money to our smallest businesses that truly need it. https://t.co/lQkJXIUZBm

Neighborhood businesses are being shut out from relief while large companies receive millions. I'm talking about bodegas, nail salons, florists and more.

So today, @RepPressley and I introduced the Saving Our Street Act to provide grants for micro-businesses that truly need it.

I'm leading my colleagues in a push to save Native and Tribal health facilities. We're in the middle of a pandemic and we can’t let these facilities close down while these communities are disproportionately impacted by COVID-19. https://t.co/FiChvc4Bpk

Yesterday I led more than 50 of my colleagues in a push for more funds for Tribal and Urban Indian Health Facilities.

Our Tribal and Native communities are disproportionately impacted by COVID-19 and these health facilities are in danger of closing. We can't let that happen.

In some areas, Native women are murdered at a rate 10x the national average. Countless Native women & girls remain missing.

On National Day of Awareness for Missing and Murdered Native Women and Girls, we must speak out for those impacted and commit to ending this crisis. #MMIWG

We’re proposing a common sense solution to lift up our struggling restaurant industry and address the crisis of hunger created by this pandemic. Proud to work alongside @RepMcGovern, @RepThompson, @SenatorTimScott, and @chefjoseandres on the FEED Act. https://t.co/95DOm6xf7z

Earlier today I spoke with @ProtectOurCare about why the Affordable Care Act is so important during this pandemic.

If Republicans & Trump have their way, millions could lose their health care in the middle of a global health crisis. The stakes could not be higher—we must fight.
SSI and VA beneficiaries: TODAY is the deadline to apply with the IRS to receive $500 dependent payments. Don’t miss out on this last chance to receive this money. https://t.co/VH7hVUXLaq

Here's something we can fix right now: we have a crisis of hunger and an economic crisis facing our restaurant industry, including farmers. Cities should be able to pay local restaurants to deliver meals to vulnerable people.

I introduced the FEED Act today to ensure they can.

My question to Rep. Ratcliffe in his confirmation hearing today to be the next DNI: do you believe Trump has accurately conveyed the severity of the threat of COVID-19 to the American people?
 
He said "I believe so." But the facts say otherwise. https://t.co/H2eYnIQJF0

We're seeing a sharp increase in threats targeting Asian-American and other minority communities—no doubt fueled by Trump's xenophobic statements.

That's why @SenatorDurbin and I are pushing Senate leadership for emergency funding to address hate crimes during the pandemic.

Here's how likely minority-owned businesses are to be DENIED from PPP loans:

Black-owned: 95%
Latino-owned: 91%
Native Hawaiian or Pacific Islander-owned: 91%
Asian-owned: 75%

This is not what an equitable COVID-19 response looks like. I'm working to fix it.
You made a great choice, Jade! Congratulations and welcome to the @HowardU family. https://t.co/0Z9Klz9m2O

So we're clear about Mitch McConnell's priorities this week: he's pushing to confirm Justin Walker, a 37 y/o conservative ideologue, to the DC Circuit Court.

And on top of that, we already know this nominee has attacked SCOTUS's ruling upholding the ACA. https://t.co/gms4c2HEPg

I said it after Hurricane Maria and I’m saying it now: we need an accurate death count. It's critical to understanding COVID-19's impact.

In 2018, I passed a bill to study and ensure this—but until that study is finished, FEMA needs to establish protocols for this pandemic, now.

Absolutely unacceptable that Trump is prioritizing bailing out Big Oil companies while dragging his feet to support millions of unemployed people, workers, small businesses, and state and local governments. The American people are tired of this.

California is once again leading the way. Essential workers deserve to have peace of mind that their children are taken care of while they are doing the critical work of getting us through this pandemic. Visit https://t.co/88yL7ADQV7 for more information. https://t.co/WKXXVa4sWW

A new study found that unless we reduce the number of detained people in ICE detention centers, up to 100% of immigrants in custody could contract COVID-19 within 90 days. 100%.
 
DHS needs to prioritize the release of low-risk and vulnerable people—immediately.

My new bill would create a COVID-19 Racial and Ethnic Disparities Task Force because this pandemic is highlighting deep racial disparities that have long existed in our country—and we need to act. https://t.co/rya5AePPlX
Right now, Attorney General Bill Barr has DOJ lawyers—who work for taxpayers and the federal government—in the Supreme Court trying to dismantle the Affordable Care Act. Remember that.

To small business owners in CA struggling to get PPP funds: know that I hear you and I'm pushing Mnuchin and the SBA to fix this.

This is especially frustrating when large companies are securing millions in loans. This won’t stand, and I’m demanding answers and accountability.

We could not get through this pandemic without the tireless work of farm workers in California and across the nation. Heartening to see Californians come together to recognize their work like this.
 
I'm fighting to ensure farm workers have the protections they need. https://t.co/Lb17TAE5xG

Otay Mesa has the most COVID-19 cases of any ICE detention facility. That's why I called for an investigation into the treatment of people held there.

There's no question that low-risk and vulnerable detained persons need to be safely released to prevent the spread of the virus. https://t.co/PUxoOj7Gty

This #MayDay and every day, I'm thinking about our essential workers who are working tirelessly to get us through this pandemic. We must do more to support them.

That means hazard pay, paid leave, and free COVID-19 tests and treatment regardless of their immigration status.

Private debt collectors should not line their pockets with people’s $1,200 direct payments while families struggle to feed their babies and pay the rent.

Governors are stepping up to prevent this—I'm pushing Secretary Mnuchin to prohibit this nationwide. https://t.co/5EJgJwtT5p

Honored to be on this list as we kick off Asian Pacific American Heritage Month.

Our AAPI community represents a rich diversity of cultures that make America stronger. We must continue fighting for equality for all AAPI people and speak out against the rise in racist attacks. https://t.co/MwyzfRVarP

Funeral costs are simply unattainable when millions of people have lost their incomes. Some are having to make arrangements for multiple family members at once.

I'm proud to partner with @AOC today on our bill to open federal assistance for funeral costs & more during pandemics. https://t.co/8gyFZmZF99

Millions of voters in Los Angeles County will now automatically receive vote-by-mail ballots. This is huge and I'm proud to see the LA area leading the way.

It's critical that other jurisdictions move quickly to ensure safe elections in November. https://t.co/v11EOh67HW

Andrea Circle Bear is the first woman to die in federal prison from COVID-19. She was pregnant, and her baby survived after being delivered by C-section. My heart is with her family and loved ones.

During the pandemic, DOJ must release more pregnant women to home confinement. https://t.co/4J9BfZxETy

It's May 1, meaning rent and bills are due for millions who have lost their incomes. A single $1,200 check is not enough when bills come every month.

We must send people money every single month throughout the pandemic. It’s just common sense.

Earlier today, I spoke about racial disparities and my new bill to create a Racial and Ethnic Disparities Task Force.

What I said: we need an equitable response to this crisis that ensures vaccines and treatment are made available based on need and not just access.

What is happening at Terminal Island prison is a public health crisis. More than half of the 1,055 inmates have tested positive for COVID-19. 4 have died.

DOJ must step in to protect staff and inmates, and immediately release certain low-risk offenders. https://t.co/1kLlRNXQ4j

Reminder that Mitch McConnell is bringing the Senate back into session next week with nothing on the schedule to address the coronavirus crisis. Instead, he wants to confirm more judges. In the middle of a pandemic.

Today, I'm announcing my new bill to create a COVID-19 Racial and Ethnic Disparities Task Force.

We need a serious, targeted effort to address the reality that Black and brown people are disproportionately being infected and dying from COVID-19 across the nation. https://t.co/AdFosf2yi4

Mitch McConnell is suggesting that the federal government should not help state and local governments on the frontlines of this crisis. So let’s do the math and deconstruct this. https://t.co/i7z4RiMLKM

Proud to work alongside @RepPressley to ensure minority-owned small businesses aren't shut out from the paycheck protection program. We're talking about businesses like barber shops, bodegas, and nail salons. Without them, our neighborhoods won't be the same. https://t.co/q03qLlcOEe

You can't take online classes without internet.
You can't work from home without internet.
You can't apply for a job online if you don't have internet.

Congress must prioritize expanding broadband in poor and rural communities.

We cannot praise the essential work of our immigrant community while continuing to shut so many of them out of coronavirus relief.

One thing I'm pushing for: ensuring everyone, regardless of their immigration status, has access to free testing and free treatment for COVID-19. https://t.co/A2ScRlM459

My heart is absolutely broken for Amber Isaac's family and loved ones. At just 26 years old, Amber passed away from complications after giving birth to her son.

We need to speak truth that this pandemic is highlighting deep racial disparities in our health care system. https://t.co/mPuJavyLct

This is an outrage. More than 55,000 Americans have died from coronavirus and Senate Republicans still want to prioritize stacking our courts with ideologues. We won’t stand for this. https://t.co/04xpBJZZxe
This is a horrific abuse of power. This officer must be held accountable. https://t.co/jcAABFzWvj

Listen to Jessica’s plea for protective equipment. She’s a Respiratory Therapist in CA who assists with intubations and needs this equipment so her own life isn’t at risk.

Our health care workers still need supplies. Trump, what’s it going to take? https://t.co/FSPhNGfMJW

26 million Americans have lost their income—no one should profit off their pain. Countless people are relying on credit cards just to put food on the table. We need a suspension of credit card interest, fees, and penalties—now.

It’s shameful that large public companies have received millions in federal loans while mom-and-pop businesses continue to struggle.

I'll say it again: Congress must prioritize minority & underserved businesses that desperately need money to stay afloat. https://t.co/9tguPv9ASV

We need to know whether politics has played a role in the Trump administration's COVID-19 response and distribution of critical resources.

Last week, my colleagues and I sent a letter to HHS and FEMA's Inspectors General demanding broad investigations.

I’m proud that the Rainbow PUSH Coalition endorsed my VoteSafe Act over the weekend. This pandemic isn't close to being over and my bill will ensure voting is safe and accessible for all in November. https://t.co/SywuDbUSYm

Thinking about these words today on what would have been the great Coretta Scott King's 93rd birthday: “Freedom is never really won. You earn it and win it in every generation.” May her fight for justice and equality live on in all of us. #CelebratingCoretta

An update on this: the IRS has extended the deadline to May 5 for SSI and VA beneficiaries to apply to receive $500 dependent payments.

This is great news, but the IRS must offer an extension for others who don’t file taxes and need to claim a child, including SS beneficiaries. https://t.co/ED9mqaQwPa

Now is not the time to be giving away money to a small group of wealthy Americans. It's outrageous that Senate Republicans continue to support a tax break for this group as part of COVID-19 relief.

I cosponsored a bill last week to repeal the tax giveaway.
To our hundreds of thousands of DREAMers waking up today anxiously awaiting SCOTUS’ ruling on DACA: I see you, I’m with you, and we are in this together. You belong here. #Heretostay

You cannot practice physical distancing in shelter facilities with dozens of other children and staff. I'm leading a call for the safe release of more than 2,400 immigrant children in US custody. Their health must be our priority. https://t.co/h3ducXvc0M

People across America are going hungry because of the ongoing pandemic. Ensuring that children, the elderly and people with disabilities are fed must be a priority in Congress.
 
My new bill will expand SNAP benefits to ensure people can afford to eat. https://t.co/h5S6CSFkzI

The American people deserve a comprehensive solution to vote during the pandemic. I'm proposing $5 billion to:

-Expand vote-by-mail
-Require nationwide early voting for at least 20 days
-Ensure in-person voting is safe and accessible for those who need it
https://t.co/YwJjW4KWnC

More than 200,000 DACA recipients and 130,000 TPS holders are working essential jobs. The last thing they need is to worry about deportation while helping fight this crisis.

@SenatorDurbin and I are pushing the administration to automatically extend their work authorizations.

SCOTUS could decide on DACA any week now. These young people deserve to know if their personal information—that our country promised not to use for immigration enforcement—will be used against them.

I’ve been asking this administration that question since January 2017. https://t.co/s7ZtxSKIPk

Our prisons needed reform long before the pandemic, and this crisis is highlighting why. You can’t practice physical distancing in a prison, and incarcerated individuals shouldn’t have to risk their lives in these inhumane conditions. https://t.co/4dk1RCmDyW

We need to expand vote-by-mail. But we must also acknowledge that vote-by-mail isn't feasible for everyone, including Tribal residents whose addresses aren't recognized by USPS.
 
My VoteSafe Act would ensure in-person voting is safe for those who need it. https://t.co/nRAZDG2suA

As we mark 105 years since the beginning of the Armenian Genocide, we cannot forget the 1.5 million Armenians killed between 1915 and 1923. It's on all of us to acknowledge this horrific chapter in history and ensure it never repeats.
I can't believe this needs to be said, but please do not ingest any kind of disinfectant. It will not kill the coronavirus. Trump is spreading dangerous misinformation and endangering lives.

We have a hunger crisis in America impacting everyone from the unemployed to children, the elderly, and people with disabilities. That's why I have a bill to help people put food on the table and ensure folks don’t go hungry. https://t.co/ptZxIlqL1O

FEMA has a long history of racial disparities in its disaster response—and we're not going to stand for it, especially during a pandemic that’s disproportionately impacting people of color.

Today, I'm demanding FEMA address this issue and make transparent its plans to fix it.

Marijuana small businesses employ more than 240,000 workers and should be allowed to access coronavirus relief funds too. My colleagues and I are pushing to ensure they’re not left out of Congress’s next relief package.

People across the country are going hungry and debt collectors have the gall to try to seize the $1,200 direct payments. Unacceptable.

I applaud this move by Governor @GavinNewsom and it's precisely why I'm pushing for it nationwide. Mnuchin needs to act on this immediately. https://t.co/oRfpWpk7P9

It was the height of irresponsibility to force people in Wisconsin to risk their lives in order to vote. We have to make sure this doesn't happen again.

My VoteSafe Act would ensure voting is safe and accessible for all. https://t.co/6qKiKhSZKb

Let me emphasize what I told @JamilSmith: this pandemic is an opportunity to address longstanding issues that are now pounding on our door. That includes paid sick leave, health care disparities, and so much more. https://t.co/mNjjwc2gBW

Wishing a blessed #Ramadan season to all those observing in California and around the world. These are difficult days and an important time to remember the power of reflection, compassion, and hope. Ramadan Mubarak.

People desperately need these $1,200 payments to put food on the table and pay for necessities. It's outrageous that private debt collectors are trying to seize this money to line their pockets. I'm leading my colleagues in a push to stop this. https://t.co/w5Vad2gvqz
Be sure to tune in to Power 106 in a few minutes at 10:40AM PT and listen to my interview @NickCannon! https://t.co/gjUpBdkNLz

My new bill with @gillibrandny and @SenSanders will commit more resources so our most vulnerable people can afford food, because no one should go hungry—especially in a public health crisis. https://t.co/h5S6CSFkzI

It's simple: there's no more basic need than food, and right now countless people have lost their income and are going hungry.

I'm announcing a new bill today to ensure people have enough food to get through the end of the month.

Since January 2017, I've been asking the Trump administration this very question—will they keep our country's promise that DACA recipients' personal information won't be used for immigration enforcement?

These young people deserve to know. https://t.co/dCzqSE7axR

Fighting a virus means listening to doctors and following the science. If true, this is yet another brazen example of Trump caring more about scoring points than speaking truth and saving lives. An absolute failure of leadership. https://t.co/yKZQbi0IQU

There's no sugar coating this. People will die because of Trump’s commitment to rolling back major anti-pollution measures, and communities of color are already suffering the most. This is why we fight. #EarthDay https://t.co/CFOfJlaJMM

At least 40 immigrant children in US custody have contracted coronavirus, and that number is likely to rise. It's our moral obligation to protect their health and safety first.

Today, @RepEscobar and I are demanding the safe release of nearly 2,400 detained immigrant children.

As we mark the 50th anniversary of #EarthDay, the success of our cause is more urgent than ever. In the midst of this deadly pandemic, Trump's dangerous environmental policies will cost lives—particularly in communities of color. https://t.co/vsuwe8WxSy

"Of the 5.8 million people working health care jobs that pay less than $30,000 a year, half are nonwhite and 83 percent are women."

We could not fight this pandemic without women, in particular women of color. https://t.co/4spitdK81M

This Holocaust Remembrance Day, we remember the six million Jewish people who were murdered and recommit ourselves to eliminating anti-Semitism across the globe. It is our moral responsibility to stand firm against bigotry and ensure this kind of hate never happens again.

DEADLINE ALERT: Social security, railroad retirement, or VA beneficiaries—TOMORROW by 9:00AM PST is the deadline to file with the IRS to receive a $500 dependent payment.

Californians, please contact my office for assistance if you encounter any issues. https://t.co/WcrTcKxpCD

I support today's emergency bill to help small businesses and health care providers—but I cannot overstate how insufficient this is.

Congress is failing to help feed those who lost their income and are going hungry. We need to help families struggling to put food on the table.

Small businesses in California have received the *least* PPP loans per capita of any state, and @SenFeinstein and I are demanding to know why.

CA was the first to issue a stay-at-home order and our small businesses have been shut down longer than anywhere else. We need answers.

Charging exorbitant prices for things like soap and hand sanitizer in the middle of a pandemic is immoral and dangerous. I introduced a bill to make price gouging illegal nationwide—Congress must include it in the next relief package.

The facts are indisputable. My colleagues and I on the Senate Intelligence Committee agree that Russia interfered in the 2016 presidential election and did so to help Donald Trump.
 
We must do everything in our power to protect our elections—now. https://t.co/1yPX0tsheP

Black Americans shouldn't fear being targeted by law enforcement for wearing face masks during a pandemic. I'm pushing Attorney General Barr and FBI Directory Wray to require racial bias training for police. https://t.co/HtUGDxJJo5

Trump failed to take this crisis seriously from day 1. His abandonment of his role as president has cost lives. And now, he's shamelessly politicizing this pandemic to double down on his anti-immigrant agenda.

Enough, Mr. President. The American people are fed up. https://t.co/pT5edXBIT5

Wildfire and hurricane season is approaching & we will be tested in unprecedented ways because of the ongoing pandemic. FEMA must have a plan.

I just led 80 members of Congress in a letter to FEMA demanding they outline natural disaster preparation & recovery plans for COVID-19.

This pandemic isn’t close to being over, and yet the authorization for National Guard troops on the frontlines of responding to COVID-19 will soon expire. We need them to continue the fight in California and around the country.

I’m demanding Trump extend the authorization.

The reality is that this pandemic is not affecting everyone equally. People of color, in particular Black communities, are being disproportionately impacted. I thank Beyoncé for using her voice to speak this truth. https://t.co/z7Fxl3kMYx

This virus impacts everyone—it doesn't care about race, ethnicity, or immigration status. And that means vital COVID-19 resources must be available regardless of immigration status.

Our bill would ensure immigrants aren't left out of critical coronavirus relief resources. https://t.co/Z7YVEsy6Vh

It's time to legalize marijuana and bring justice to people of color harmed by failed drug policies. My bill to do that has already passed the House—I remain committed to getting it passed in the Senate.

Last week, I announced my new bill to provide $5 billion to ensure our elections are safe and accessible during the coronavirus pandemic. The right to vote is fundamental—we must protect it. https://t.co/KBmvkzsEUE

Trump said last month that anyone who wants a test for COVID-19 can get one. That's not true—there still aren’t nearly enough tests.
 
The American people need Trump to show leadership and ensure we produce the tests and supplies to adequately combat this crisis.

Tomorrow marks another day that SCOTUS may rule on DACA and upend thousands of lives, including more than 200,000 essential workers on the frontlines of this pandemic.

To our DREAMers: I see you and no matter what, I will continue fighting for you to remain here in your home.

Coronavirus doesn’t care about race, political party, or immigration status. Yet in the middle of a pandemic, Otay Mesa Detention Center personnel reportedly withheld face masks until immigrant detainees signed waivers.
 
Unacceptable. I'm demanding an investigation. https://t.co/DGGb4PkpyI

Yesterday marked the end of Black Maternal Health Week, but let’s be clear this is an issue that deserves our attention all year.

Black mothers are dying from pregnancy at higher rates and this pandemic could exacerbate those disparities. https://t.co/OfDnBQTrm3
Every person across the country, regardless of their immigration status, should have access to free testing and free treatment for COVID-19.

I've been pushing for racial data on COVID-19 and I'm glad to see that the CDC has released some of this information. But we need to do more.
 
People of color are disproportionately suffering from this pandemic. Congressional leaders must prioritize this disparity. https://t.co/rW6Df6oKwc

All people living in the U.S. should participate in the 2020 Census. Participating is confidential and ensures your local community gets its share of transportation, education, and healthcare funding. 

Visit https://t.co/gW9kLYrgjl to make sure you're counted.

Yesterday's unemployment numbers were staggering. 22 million Americans have now lost their jobs because of this pandemic.

To Mitch McConnell: Congress has to get back to work. People need to eat and keep a roof over their heads. That means ensuring monthly cash payments.

Minority-owned businesses have long faced discriminatory banking practices. It's an outrage that this is still happening in a pandemic.
 
I’m pushing for more data on small business loans to ensure people of color aren't being shut out.

Yesterday, I announced my new bill to ensure no American has to choose between their health and their right to vote.

That includes an additional $5 billion to ensure safe and accessible voting. https://t.co/9bz3ae2Hva

I’m concerned about recent reports of Black men being targeted by law enforcement based on CDC guidance to wear face masks.
 
Today, @SenBooker and I led a letter to AG Barr and FBI Director Wray demanding law enforcement training to combat racial profiling in this pandemic. https://t.co/tH19hGfxp9

Unacceptable that debt collectors are cashing in on people's $1,200 direct payments. Americans are in dire need of money to pay their rent and put food on the table—this is absurd.
 
I'm leading my colleagues today in a push to end this. https://t.co/PQFBe69ogh

Earlier today, I announced my new bill to confront the barriers to voting that are being magnified by the pandemic. The VoteSafe Act will authorize $5 billion to:

-require universal early voting
-expand vote-by-mail
-ensure safe & accessible in-person voting to those who need it

No one should be forced to choose between their health and their right to vote. I announced a new bill today to authorize $5 billion to expand early voting and vote-by-mail, and ensure safe in-person voting. https://t.co/KBmvkzsEUE

Black communities are disproportionately suffering from COVID-19. Unfortunately, this news didn’t come as a surprise to me or anyone familiar with our country’s shameful legacy of racial inequality.
 
Read my op-ed. https://t.co/97Opr9C3aQ

Looking forward to joining @RepAdams later today, along with my friends @SenBooker and @RepUnderwood, for a discussion on Black maternal health and what must be done to confront this crisis. https://t.co/K6nwooT5LU

Even before the pandemic, Native Americans, Black and Latinx voters, and voters with disabilities faced barriers to the ballot box. We have to fight back.

Today, I’m announcing the VoteSafe Act to protect every American's fundamental right to vote. https://t.co/FG4lTok7UN

This is the right move by the Bureau of Prisons and precisely why my colleagues and I pushed for it earlier this month. But let’s be clear: it’s absurd to charge inmates fees for phone calls in the first place. https://t.co/mBjqLRSxon

At Otay Mesa Detention Center, immigrants were reportedly asked to sign waivers to get face masks. In the middle of a pandemic.

That’s one of the reasons I’m calling for an investigation into the conditions at Otay Mesa. https://t.co/HsrPKvIS4e

This pandemic has blown the lid off something many of us have known our entire lives: there are deep racial disparities in our country’s health care system.

This Black Maternal Health Week, it's critical that we speak truth about the ongoing crisis of Black maternal mortality. https://t.co/YHlJUCRCn6

Today, I'm demanding an investigation into the treatment of people held at Otay Mesa Detention Center. Otay Mesa has the most COVID-19 cases of any ICE immigration detention facility and DHS isn't doing enough to prevent inhumane conditions.

We need answers and accountability.

Coronavirus appears to be disproportionately killing people of color and Congress needs to wake up and address this injustice. Today, I'm pushing Senate leadership to prioritize funding to combat racial health disparities in COVID-19 testing and outcomes.

.@AOC is right. FEMA provides Disaster Funeral Assistance for natural disasters—but not pandemics. There's no reason for this.

Last month, I introduced a bill to fix that. https://t.co/GvnHLxOgxL

Black Americans are infected and dying from COVID-19 at alarming rates, and we need demographic data to understand the full scope of the issue.

Proud to join my colleagues on a bill today to require the federal government to collect and report this data.
Racial disparities in health care existed long before the coronavirus pandemic—especially when it comes to the maternal health of Black women. https://t.co/OaufZFMgOS

Too many minority-owned businesses are being left out of coronavirus relief programs. And the truth is that our neighborhoods won't look the same without these businesses.

Today, I'm proud to reintroduce a resolution with @RepAdams to recognize this week as Black Maternal Health Week. We need to confront the reality that Black mothers are dying at higher rates from pregnancy-related causes.
The IRS has started to disburse the $1,200 payments, but we must continue the fight for recurring monthly payments. One-time payments are not enough to get our country through this crisis.

It's important to hold onto moments of joy in the midst of these difficult days. Wishing everyone renewed hope and happiness this Easter Sunday!

My tip for those celebrating away from loved ones: call or video chat instead of text—it's so much better to hear people's voices.

Even before this pandemic began, nearly half of Americans were a $400 unexpected expense away from financial disaster.

A one-time direct payment isn't enough—we need recurring monthly payments. That's why I'm pushing Congressional leaders on this very issue.

The coronavirus pandemic is highlighting long-existing racial disparities in our health care system that Black communities know all too well. As we begin Black Maternal Health Week, we must also speak truth about the crisis afflicting Black mothers and babies. https://t.co/BiAWeLprtm

Any week now, SCOTUS may rule on DACA and upend the lives of thousands of young people. It’s unconscionable to issue a ruling when over 200,000 DACA recipients are essential workers in this crisis, including 29,000 in the health care industry.

SCOTUS must delay its ruling.

Millions of people have just lost their jobs and are relying on credit cards to feed themselves and their families. No one should profit off of this pain in the middle of a pandemic.

That’s why I’m calling for a suspension of credit card interest, fees, and penalties.

Exploiting people who are suffering during this pandemic is immoral. Price gouging on household necessities only adds unnecessary stress for people just trying to get by. Proud today to introduce a bill to make price gouging illegal nationwide. https://t.co/adKpLkxIV9

Right now, many public defenders are still showing up in courtrooms to keep vulnerable people out of overcrowded jails and to advocate for sentencing reductions. It's time for Congress to support this critical work.

@RepTedDeutch & I are pushing for more public defender funding.
28 million people across the country were uninsured before this pandemic began. They need a chance to sign up for a health care plan in the middle of a deadly pandemic.

Bodegas.
Food trucks.
Convenience stores.
Barber shops and nail salons.

Our neighborhoods won't be the same without businesses like these that are overwhelmingly owned by people of color. The Small Business Administration needs to do more to help minority-owned businesses.

One-time payments are not enough. People need more money in their pockets, and sending monthly payments to workers and families is the best way to address that need.

Today, I led more than 50 members of Congress in pushing leadership for recurring monthly cash payments.

This pandemic is exploiting long existing environmental injustices all across the country. Clean air is a human right but too many communities are suffering from toxic air pollution. We must fight for clean air for all. https://t.co/JewwDkJ9U7

Republicans just blocked a critical bill to aid small businesses, all because it also included help for communities on the frontlines, hospitals, and nutrition benefits for those going hungry. Shameful.

Passover reminds us of the importance of renewed hope and the promise of new beginnings. To all those celebrating—I hope you have a wonderful holiday and find moments of joy in the midst of these difficult days.

Those words are especially meaningful today. No matter how dark these days may seem, we will get through it.
